ca.mcgill.ecse211.finalproject.controller

Class BlockDetection

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.finalproject.controller.BlockDetection

  • public class BlockDetection
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains all methods necessary to detect the enemy's flag based on light intensity readings.
    It is is instantiated within the controller and its respective methods are called upon by the controller as well. The algorithm used to detect blocks and find the right one is the edge follower. The implemented algorithm makes the robot travel from corner to corner in an anticlockwise manner. The anticlockwise is important as it always points the color sensor towards the blocks. By having this method of only following the border, we maximize our chances of detecting the flag without spending too much time searching.

    • Method Detail

      • findFlag

        public void findFlag()
        Main method of this class which will contain logic to go about finding the opponents flag. It navigates robot to the flag zone and then instructs it to looks for blocks and identify enemy flag. This method also represents one of the states that controller will be in along the competition.

      • distanceBetweenPoint

        public static double distanceBetweenPoint(double x1,
                                          double y1,
                                          double x2,
                                          double y2)
        Method that is used to find distance to all four corners of the search region
        Parameters:
        x1 - x-coordinate of desired corner
        y1 - y-coordinate of desired corner
        Returns:
        distance to desired corner

      • determineColor

        private void determineColor(int number)
        Determines color of detected block using intensityBuffer values. This method will therefore help to determine if block found is indeed the flag of the opposing team.

      • foundFlag

        public boolean foundFlag()
        This method polls the color sensor on the side of the robot, with a maximum frequency, to determine if the block to the left of the robot is indeed the flag that we must find
        Returns:
        hasflagfound which tells if the flag has been found yet

      • gotoSearch

        public void gotoSearch()
        This method brings the robot to the closest corner of the search zone relative to its current position as to not waste time. The method also localizes at that corner to ensure accuracy with our odometer.

      • search

        public void search()
        This is the method that actually implements the logic of the flag searching amongst the blocks in the search zone. To accomplish this task, the robot drives from corner to corner while looking if the block if the flag. This method is quite easy however, it covers quite a few cases while only failing in a few cases. The whole search algorithm also has a timeout in case the search takes too long.
